Description: Fragment of plain weave, undyed linen (a) with an applied tapestry panel (b); (a) has a band of empty warp threads preceeding a warp fringe; Warp: S spun, c. 23 tpc; Weft: S spun, c. 13 tpc; Edges: 1 selvedge, 1 fringe, other edges cut; Sewing: joining b) to a), running stitch (some very large) and overcasting, linen thread; Panel (b) is a star-shaped tapestry on single (?) warp threads, in purple wool with details in undyed linen inc. wrapped float brocading; Field of octagons linked via squares, border is an undulating line with circles to either side and plain weft-faced linen surrounding; Warp: not visible, c. 7-8? tpc; Weft: linen and wool S spun, c. 70 tpc; Edges: not visible probably cut
Curator's comments: Previous location Cupboard 64, green box; Panel probably sewn to main textile as a re-use, having been cut from an otherwise worn garment; Main cloth probably used as a mantle before burial; Edges cut since excavation; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (24.8.1989)
Condition: Unknown date stuck to sticky net; (a) medium, rotten in areas; (b) Good, stained in one corner
Acquisition notes: Collection purchased at sale on 6th Dec 1954, lots 154, 155 and 156.
